snippet.textDisplay: TheMostBleedingHeart I disagree. The 3ds one gives a feeling of utter despair and that something sinister happened which I feel fits the game better overall. And the 3ds one is also the official definitive version of the song since it’s based off the symphonic suites which is how the composer wants the ost to really sound like.
snippet.textOriginal: TheMostBleedingHeart I disagree. The 3ds one gives a feeling of utter despair and that something sinister happened which I feel fits the game better overall. And the 3ds one is also the official definitive version of the song since it’s based off the symphonic suites which is how the composer wants the ost to really sound like.

snippet.textDisplay: _that's it... I just can't do this anymore... I just can't do it... Is this what it's like to be an adult? Lose all happiness in life? Is all the magic in the world gone... except your heart ripped right out of your chest? I don't know you guys, I never thought this day would come... I think it's finally time... I have to do it._ * shaves goatee while crying *

snippet.textDisplay:
@SupraDarky I remember it took my first play (back in 2001 when I was 11) 2 years to beat, half of that gameplay was with a gameshark lol.

But it took me only around 30 days to beat in 2011. I was kind of shocked that I remembered the map and where to go lol. But to think it took my first try 2 YEARS lol. I still have the old disc... worth 150 dollars, and never will sell it xD
snippet.textOriginal:
@SupraDarky I remember it took my first play (back in 2001 when I was 11) 2 years to beat, half of that gameplay was with a gameshark lol.

snippet.textDisplay: Really? Took me 70 to beat the main campaign, and only after did I start on side quests. Plugged in well over 100 hours by the time I was done. DQVII would almost undeniably be #1 on such a list. I'd really like to know if any game is longer.
snippet.textOriginal: Really? Took me 70 to beat the main campaign, and only after did I start on side quests. Plugged in well over 100 hours by the time I was done. DQVII would almost undeniably be #1 on such a list. I'd really like to know if any game is longer.

snippet.textDisplay: This is one of the BEST RPG's that I've ever had the pleasure of playing. Like SupraDarky said, some of those stories were SOOOOO well written and they definetly pull at the heart strings big time. To date, this game holds the record for taking the most amount of hours for me to finish it. I believe I finished at 137 hours! This game is amazing! If you've never played it, buckle in for a long and awesome adventure!
snippet.textOriginal: This is one of the BEST RPG's that I've ever had the pleasure of playing. Like SupraDarky said, some of those stories were SOOOOO well written and they definetly pull at the heart strings big time. To date, this game holds the record for taking the most amount of hours for me to finish it. I believe I finished at 137 hours! This game is amazing! If you've never played it, buckle in for a long and awesome adventure!

snippet.textDisplay: I beat Xenoblade in 83 hours but at least 20 of those were taken up by the sidequests. In contrast, I can't see DQVII being beaten any earlier than 80 hours. It's hard to remember if I did any side stuff but I don't recall any.
snippet.textOriginal: I beat Xenoblade in 83 hours but at least 20 of those were taken up by the sidequests. In contrast, I can't see DQVII being beaten any earlier than 80 hours. It's hard to remember if I did any side stuff but I don't recall any.

snippet.textDisplay: I can't wait to play DQVII. I've played I-IX (minus number VII of course) and have enjoyed my time with every game except for IX. I'd definitely say VIII has my favorite soundtrack. Sugiyama does such an amazing job with his compositions, and he's by far my favorite composer both in video game music and overall.
snippet.textOriginal: I can't wait to play DQVII. I've played I-IX (minus number VII of course) and have enjoyed my time with every game except for IX. I'd definitely say VIII has my favorite soundtrack. Sugiyama does such an amazing job with his compositions, and he's by far my favorite composer both in video game music and overall.

snippet.textDisplay: This sad theme plays in the towns that are facing different kinds of problems  and that you haven't saved yet. Keep being awesome, Sugiyama. He's 82 years old now and still composing for this series.
snippet.textOriginal: This sad theme plays in the towns that are facing different kinds of problems  and that you haven't saved yet. Keep being awesome, Sugiyama. He's 82 years old now and still composing for this series.

snippet.textDisplay: I completed this game last month (took me 105 hours to max/do everything) and I loved it. I kept pushing the game away because it was intimidating to start playing such a notoriously huge RPG. It's now my third favorite in the series after 5 and 3. It's basically a series of substories and some of them were super well written and memorable, even emotional. Unfortunately, there's some padding that lengthens the game by about 20-30 hours since you basically have to revisit each town/dungeon twice.
snippet.textOriginal: I completed this game last month (took me 105 hours to max/do everything) and I loved it. I kept pushing the game away because it was intimidating to start playing such a notoriously huge RPG. It's now my third favorite in the series after 5 and 3. It's basically a series of substories and some of them were super well written and memorable, even emotional. Unfortunately, there's some padding that lengthens the game by about 20-30 hours since you basically have to revisit each town/dungeon twice.
